perturbation.original_text:
beginning
on the tenth (10th) day after the execution of this Agreement and thereafter on
the last day of each month during the Term of this Agreement, eDiets shall pay
to Women.com a monthly fee in the amount set forth on Exhibit C unless adjusted
as set forth in Section 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]. Following the Initial Term, Women.com shall have
the right, upon no fewer than sixty (60) days prior written notice to eDiets, to
increase the amount of the Payment Schedule; provided, that (i) Women.com may
not increase the Payment Schedule more than once in any period of twelve (12)
consecutive months; and (ii) such increase may not exceed twenty percent (20%)
of the then current Payment Schedule.
perturbation.changed_text:
beginning
on the tenth (10th) day after the execution of this Agreement and thereafter on
the last day of each month during the Term of this Agreement, eDiets shall pay
to Women.com a monthly fee in the amount set forth on Exhibit C unless adjusted
as set forth in Section 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]. Following the Initial Term, Women.com shall have
the right, upon no fewer than thirty (30) days prior written notice to eDiets, to
increase the amount of the Payment Schedule; provided, that (i) Women.com may
increase the Payment Schedule more than twice in any period of twelve (12)
consecutive months; and (ii) such increase may not exceed fifty percent (50%)
of the then current Payment Schedule.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by modifying the notice period for increasing the payment schedule from 60 to 30 days. Also, it modifies the number of times Women.com can increase the payment schedule from once to twice and the percentage of increase from 20% to 50%. This directly conflicts with the original terms, creating ambiguity and uncertainty in the enforcement of payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
within sixty (60) days after such Termination Date, eDiets
shall pay to Woman.com any and all payment due under this Agreement for
delivered advertising and promotions inventory in accordance with Sections 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]
and 6.1.
perturbation.changed_text:
within thirty (30) days after such Termination Date, eDiets
shall pay to Woman.com any and all payment due under this Agreement for
delivered advertising and promotions inventory in accordance with Sections 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]
and 6.1.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a payment deadline of 60 days after the termination date. This modification reduces this payment deadline to 30 days, creating a direct conflict. This introduces uncertainty as to which deadline should be enforced and creates a potential dispute over payment timing.

perturbation.original_text:
For the purposes of this Agreement, "Affiliate" shall mean another
entity that controls, is controlled by or is under common control with such
party; provided, however, that such entity is not a human being. For purposes of
this definition, the terms "controls," "is controlled by," or "is under common
control with," refer to the power to direct the policies and day-to-day
operations of an entity, whether by virtue of ownership of a voting securities,
contract, or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text:
For the purposes of this Agreement, "Affiliate" shall mean another
entity that is somehow affiliated with or has a business relationship with such
party; provided, however, that such entity is not a human being. For purposes of
this definition, the terms "controls," "is controlled by," or "is under common
control with," refer to the power to influence the policies and day-to-day
operations of an entity, whether through the recommendation of policies, by contract or some other handshake agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by changing the definition of "Affiliate" to include entities with a business relationship, rather than defining 'control' through ownership. This contradicts other contract sections that rely on the original definition to determine liabilities, and introduces legal uncertainty and potential disputes over obligations.
